intro: Uvariodendron usambarense, commonly known as the Usambara olive, is a member of the Oleaceae family and is native to the montane forests of East Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest for conservation and horticultural purposes.
